page.title: 08POSTLIP MILL - Pt.2
page.content: Paper begins life as a tree, usually a fast growing species providing softer longer fibres. Once pulped the paper resembles solid cottonwool. Most of the wood used comes from N.America and Tunisia.(eg asparto and eucalyptus) The pulping machine breaks the wood down into seperate fibres, this watery mix is then drained on butter muslin which is like a fine mesh. Postlip Mills sell their product worldwide including to Japan, Africa and South America. The paper is made into rolls about 5feet wide that weigh about 1/4 ton. Yearly, P.M. makes 2500 tons of paper (about 10 tons per day) on a five day week. 550feet of paper a minute can be made. The workforce of 120 people work shifts - 06.00 to 14.00;14.00 to 22.00; 22.00 to 06.00. (5)
